intro: Toxocarpus wightianus, commonly known as the Wight's thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are compound, with serrated edges, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in umbels. The fruit is a schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature.
